datafield.subfield: Influence of Base RoughnessBase Roughness on Kinematic and Mechanical Characteristics of Debris Flows

This paper presents simulations of debris flowsDebris flows impacting on a retaining wall along a slope channel using the discrete element methoddiscrete element method . The microscopic fabricMicroscopic fabric of the debris-flow deposits is analyzed to assess the stability of internal structure. The fundamental relationship between the base roughnessBase roughness and the stability of debris-flow deposits is analyzed. The DEM simulations show that base roughness has a significant influence on the kinematic and mechanical characteristics of debris flows, determining the relative significance of particle collisions and contact shearing inside the granular body. The forces acting on particles are also affected by base roughness. The mechanical differences among grains of mixed sizes give rise to varying degrees of dispersive trend developed inside the granular body. The fabric structure of debris-flow deposits and the packing density change when the base roughness differs.
